question: 1. Which of the following is NOT a benefit of using threads in an operating system?
options: D) Scalability in utilizing system resources
C) Higher cost compared to process creation
B) Reduced overhead compared to process creation
correct_answer: D) Scalability in utilizing system resources

question: 2. What is a disadvantage of the many-to-one threading model?
options: A) High overhead in context switching
C) Limited scalability in utilizing system resources
B) Difficulty managing multiple kernel threads
D) Increased complexity in resource sharing
correct_answer: A) High overhead in context switching

question: 3. In the many-to-many threading model, how are user threads and kernel threads mapped?
5. Which threading model provides the best balance between flexibility and efficiency in resource sharing?
6. What is a limitation of the one-to-one threading model?
options: B) Higher overhead compared to process creation
A) Increased complexity in managing multiple user threads
C) Limited scalability in utilizing system resources
D) Difficulty in synchronous communication between threads
correct_answer: B) Higher overhead compared to process creation

question: 7. Which threading model is generally considered to have the lowest overhead in context switching?
8. What is a disadvantage of using thread pools in an operating system?
options: B) Difficulty in managing multiple user threads
C) Limited flexibility in resource sharing
A) Higher overhead compared to creating individual threads
D) Increased complexity in synchronous communication between threads
correct_answer: B) Difficulty in managing multiple user threads

question: 9. In the many-to-many threading model, how are kernel threads managed?
options: B) Manually mapped to multiple user threads

question: 10. Which threading model provides the most flexibility in managing multiple user threads and kernel threads?
